title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) — On a night where offensive struggles defined the game for both sides, one man soared on a historic flight all his own. Hakeem Olajuwon, the Houston Rockets’ incomparable center, authored a masterpiece for the ages, pouring in a career-high 51 points to single-handedly lift his team to a gritty 94-87 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

While the rest of the combined roster labored to find the bottom of the net, Olajuwon was a study in sublime efficiency and unstoppable force. His final line was staggering: 51 points on 21-of-31 shooting, complemented by 14 rebounds for a dominant double-double. Every low-post move, every face-up jumper, was a lesson in fundamental brilliance against an Atlanta defense that had no answer.

The Hawks, led by 24 points from Steve Smith, hung tough through the offensive drought, but The Dream was a nightmare they could not wake from. Each time Houston needed a bucket to quell a rally, the ball found its way into Olajuwon’s hands in the paint, and the result was almost always the same—a silken swoosh through the net.

This was not a game of flashy fast breaks or a flurry of three-pointers; it was a throwback, physical battle decided in the trenches. And in that fight, the greatest warrior of them all was Olajuwon. On this night, he didn’t just lead the Rockets to a win; he carved his name a little deeper into the record books with a performance that will echo throughout franchise history. A one-man offense, a defensive anchor, and ultimately, the sole reason Houston emerged victorious.
